titles: An elegie upon the most pious and eminent, Doctor John Hewitt.
notes: Verse - "Nature and reason both do plainly show,".
With an engraving depicting his execution.
L Copy torn and stained with loss of text; lacks engraving.
Reproduction of the originals in the British Library.
keywords: Hewit, John, 1614-1658 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
